result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Arthur L Cross Jr was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

NO alcohol.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Arthur L Cross Jr
Current: 8228 W BENDER AVE APT 3, Milwaukee, WI 53218 United States  (Effective: 05-22-2015)
Prior: 1110 N 17th Street  Apt 110, Milwaukee, WI 53233-1173 United States

ADDRESS INFO for Arthur L Cross Jr
Current: 1110 N 17th Street  Apt 110, Milwaukee, WI 53233-1173 United States  (Effective: 05-22-2015)
Prior: 1145 N Callahan Pl #311, Milwaukee, WI 53233 United States
Copy printed to record payment as there is No bond form found in file.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    Statements made as to sentencing.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 37 MONTHS consecutive to case #14CT1104 and any other sentence, with credit for 72 (seventy-two) DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 13 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 MONTHS.  
.
The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program; is eligible or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program. Court does not object to programs. 
.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and comply with treatment.
-Absolute sobriety-no illegal drugs or alcohol.
-Random urine screens.
-Mental Health Evaluation, treatment deemed appropriate.
-No driving without a valid license.
 
-Pay fine of $1800.00 PLUS all court costs, assessments and fees (including DNA surcharge) by April 10, 2018 or to be docketed as a civil judgment. Cash bail transferred from case #14CT1125 to apply.
Court ordered AODA assessment and Driver's Safety Plan.  Defendant to cooperate with any treatment recommended.  Court ordered defendant's driving privileges revoked for a period of 30 months.    Court orders defendant restricted to operation of vehicles equipped with an ignition interlock device for 30 months to commence upon eligibility to reinstate license.  
.
Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.
.
Defendant ordered to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge during Extended Supervision, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Driver Assessment And Driver Safety Plan.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

AS TO COUNT 2:

On motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge T. Christopher Dee, Branch 37. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.    Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department, Court ordered no bail set.

Defendant Arthur L Cross in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Defendant Arthur L Cross in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Court appearance in Room 615 Courthouse on 4/8/15 @ 8:30am
